Author: Fircoal
Content: Ok since we're going there anyway I think it's time to bring out some of my thoughts into the village. üòé

Author: Fircoal
Content: So here is what I was thinking. As cool as the governor sounds their powers aren't exactly that strong at this stage of the day. So while I think we all would like to be governor I don't think it's a priority for any peeps. Added to that I think there is more than just that at play. Werewolves probably are going to realize that being governor isn't actually that helpful. While having a town chancellor that could possibly block their NK is bad, it's a small chance, and probably is **the smallest chance on Night 1 than any other night.** Therefore the chancellor power is at it's weakest. Furthermore, if a werewolf is gov, in order to get a werewolf chancellor they have to pick it themselves which is going to bring a lot of suspicion onto that player if the wolfgov is ever sac'd, which means it's not a very good idea for low reward.

Author: Fircoal
Content: Why do I bring this up? Because I think the wolves will realize this and realize that the potential of looking greedy by trying to grab the gov power is not worth the tiny benefit they'd get by winning.

Author: Fircoal
Content: Thusly I feel like anyone who voted themselves to be governor is likely town

Author: Fircoal
Content: Sure but that's only if that's likely to happen, which who knows. If the wolf is a gov that makes it less likely the wolf can be a chancellor just by math.

Author: Fircoal
Content: I guess my point is, I think gov is the argument that wolves are prepared to concede. Especially this early.

Author: Fircoal
Content: Oh and as for why I'm voting mik in particular outside of not liking bandwagoning, I really don't like how he was bringing up how we should vote for the gov before we vote for sacs

Author: Fircoal
Content: Sacs are our bread and butter. That's how we get information and move the game along. 2 days is not a lot of time especially on Day 1. We need to progress, not wait for something that doesn't nearly matter as much.

Author: Fircoal
Content: Just to note, I'm not against us voting on gov and finding someone, I just also want to be wolf hunting and voting at the same time.
